page.title: 09Margam Abbey
page.content: The church comprises six of the eight bays of the former Cistercian Abbey founded in 1147. Greatly restored between 1805 - 1809 the interior furnishings are largely the gifts of the Talbot family who are buried here as are their Mansel ancestors. In the first major restoration of recent years the east end and west front have been made safe, the church re-roofed, the south aisle windows replaced and new oak doors installed in the west front. Approximately 100 parishioners attend the three Sunday services. Only a few children attend the Sunday school. A Community service programme provides manual labour to clean up the once overgrown churchyard. Within Margam Park the Abbey ruins including the unique Chapter house are being restored.
